title: Cabin for 5...Chella was wonderful
text:
Nice cabin in a pinch...storm was coming up and as we were on motorcycles needed a safe place quickly. The shared cabin was fine...nothing fancy but all was clean.
Was a good price for 5 of us and Chella (owner or manager) was more than helpful.

title: Fantastically designed museum
text: It's not only the amazing artifacts housed in the museum, but the museum itself...it is beautifully designed with large windows that look out on the Acropolis as you are seeing the pieces in front of it. Quite a treat and really should be considered a must-see.

title: Wonderful place to stay!
text: Walking distance to Chanai harbor, beautiful accommodations, spacious room...it has it all! Staff was friendly and helpful (but not always available). Free parking a short distance away. Quiet room and, did I say BEAUTIFUL?

title: A visually and historically impressive landmark
text: If you are anywhere near Athens, this is a total must-see. The historical significance can not be overstated and it is just an incredible sight to see and walk around in. If you are willing to get up early and be one of the first people there, you will not regret it. Walking around there in the early morning light with fewer people is a great reward.

title: Top notch accommodations for an overnight stay
text: Arrived on a late flight and had an early flight out the next morning...but this was the perfect place to stay the night. The driver was fantastic and the free shuttle was the main reason we picked this apartment. The apartment accommodations, however, were a wonderful surprise...a lovely, clean, large apartment in a nice area! There was a lovely breakfast supplied and countless nice touches throughout.

title: Efficient, timely, professional
text: Nice leg room, delicious meals, attentive staff, great entertainment selection, comfortable seats, on time flights, nicely priced flights...what more could you ask for?

title: Best Trekking Company Ever!
text:
From start to finish, this trekking company's organizer, Upendra, was the most professional, most helpful, most accommodating, and most personally engaging and friendly trip manager that you could have. Every single detail from domestic flight arrangements to airport drop off to trekking route requests was handled smoothly and without any stress or miscommunication. Our guide, Raju, was perfect. He was professional and knowledgeable but his engaging and friendly manner turned him into a close friend immediately.
During the trek, our party of 5 had to split up to accommodate one of the hiking member's bout with altitude sickness and seemlessly Raju and Upendra worked to enable our group to split up to allow for one group to proceed with the hike while another member rested and met up with us a day later. Every need was taken into consideration. We could not have been more pleased with this trekking company, and with Upendra and Raju in particular.
The hiking was top notch, jaw-dropping gorgeous. We intend to plan another trek soon and will look no further than this trekking company.

title: Stunning hilltop temple
text: This temple was a highlight of our stay in Kathmandu. Within easy walking distance of the Thamel district, this temple gives wonderful views of the city. The temple is impressive and exotic and is also a great place to enjoy watching monkeys.

title: Staff and accommodations make this a first-rate hotel
text: The staff...from the front desk, to restaurant, to cooks, to servers...made our stay the best it could be. Every single person we worked with was friendly, helpful, professional, and genuinely nice. The rooms are spacious and clean. The beds and pillows are comfortable. The complimentary breakfast is fresh and tasty. The cooks take pride in their meals and we enjoyed dinner and lunches there as well. The location in Thamel is superb and the gardens and courtyard are a welcome respite to relax and enjoy the quiet.

title: Castle Ehrenburg
text: A wonderful castle to visit for incredible views and to appreciate walking through an ancient fortification. Even has a lunch option. Staff helpful. Had a great time visiting this important castle.

title: Amazing, ancient cathedral
text: A gorgeous cathedral inside and out. Such an important and distinctive landmark that is a must-see. Climbing the dome was more than worth the exertion! Great views of the Rhine and city below.

title: Nice cafes and great architecture
text: A great place to go during a trip to Cologne. Beautiful old part of the city right on the river. Great views, great shops. A wonderful place to relax after climbing the cathedral tower.

title: Confluence of two great rivers
text: Nice place to enjoy some beautiful views. Take the gondola ride and really enjoy some sights. The German Corner is very picturesque and the tree-lined walkway is really lovely.

title: Gives a GREAT view of rivers
text: Nice way to enjoy the scenery of the confluence of the Rhine and Mosel Rivers. Takes you right down to the German Corner.

title: Beautiful Gardens
text: A lovely gardens with a chateau in the background. Beautiful place to walk and enjoy the shade and flowers.

title: Delicious kaiserschmarnn
text: A lovely setting and beautiful restaurant. The food was delicious and the staff pleasant and helpful. Both sweet and savory dishes were fantastic.

title: A tad unusual but views are magnificient
text: The castle did not interest me as much as the incredible location, views, and walk up. We parked in the public parking at bottom and enjoyed the walk up the hill. Great views from the turret.

title: Fabulous views and interesting ruin
text: Lovely tramping to be had in and around castle ruins. Beautiful views on village below. Was well preserved ruins and had descriptive signs here and there to explain.

title: Delicious vegetarian offerings
text: Lovely situation atop the hill overlooking town. Cozy atmosphere and delicious and varied food offerings. The vegetarian options were very appreciated and delicious!

title: Beautiful lake and castle
text: The ferry to Schloss Herrenchiemsee is a nice short ride to the island...beautiful snow capped peaks in the background. The docks at Prien have a nice coffee shop and the piers and boats keep a handy schedule.

title: A perfect apartment in a great part of the city
text:
Upon check-in, the lovely receptionist asked if we were interested in an available apartment. Was happily impressed. Fantastic little flat with full kitchen, living room, and great bath and bedroom. So clean and perfectly located 4 min. walk from Victoria Station. Clean and homey.
The complimentary breakfast was very nice. Buffet items as well as cooked to order full breakfast.
Fantastic, helpful, and friendly waitstaff!
Can't say enough positive about this hotel.

title: Lovely, spacious room!
text: The beds were very comfortable, the room clean with lots of space. It was quiet, never heard another person even though the hotel was always full of people. The only downside was the breakfast...I thought it rather lacking. But otherwise, I was very happy with my stay here!
place: Holiday Inn Express Wilmington North - Brandywine

title: Very nice place for lunch on the riverfront
text: Food was tasty but a bit pricey. We enjoyed a nice afternoon lunch on the porch overlooking the river. Service was excellent. Waitstaff very pleasant and helpful. We enjoyed our lunch and would recommend stopping here.
place: Big Fish Grill on the Riverfront

title: Have been visiting for over 40 years...still magnificient!
text: An incredible botanical gardens encompassing landscape, fountains, formal gardens, conservatories, and topiaries. An incredible place year-round.

title: Terrific little breakfast place
text: Great menu, terrific for breakfast...much better than the cheesy hotel breakfasts of packaged muffins. My husband had a greek gyro and I had a more traditional breakfast...all fantastic! Friendly waitress, too.

title: Great location
text: A perfectly comfortable hotel room, on the beach, and I suppose the rates were in keeping with the competition. The staff was especially friendly and helpful...this always makes for an inviting stay. Really the manager, the desk staff, the cleaning staff...everyone was incredibly pleasant in a genuine manner. The room was clean and all you could ask for. Didn't try out the pool as the ocean water was calling, but it looked fine.

title: Was fine for a warm drink
text: Clean, decent food, ok service...but nothing terribly special. Was right in town and the prices were high, but that is pretty standard in Iceland.

title: A great collection of motorcycles!
text: This museum has a much more extensive collection of motorcycles than one might imagine being in Iceland. My husband was enthralled! The staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. The information and background provided on each bike was interesting to one not particularly into motorcycles. My husband and I both enjoyed this museum.

title: A very nice place to relax and warm up
text: The food was great and the prices were very decent. This is a nice, cozy atmosphere for taking a break from a hectic pace. We were both happy with the food and the town in general...a nice place to stop.

title: Beautiful surroundings and great trails
text: We camped in this park and enjoyed the trails to the glacier and waterfall. Beautiful natural beauty. The campground was nicely maintained and quiet.

title: A great trail and a spectacular sight
text: The basalt columns makes this waterfall unique. There are very informative signs that explain the cooling action of the igneous rocks that create these columnar structures. Just plain cool to see! Right off the Ring Road.

title: Beautiful views of icebergs and ice fields
text: Stop at one of the parking areas before you get to the commercial pull-off...you will have great views all to yourself! We spent a lot of time walking along the cliff shore viewing the icebergs. There is great photography potential at these pull-offs that are slightly higher than at the lower parking lot by the bridge.

title: Dramatic Icelandic scenery at its best!
text: This is a unique area and right on the Ring Road...would be a shame to miss this. Icebergs and ice fields - all quite beautiful and dramatic. Makes for some fantastic photography!

title: Helpful and interesting
text: Very helpful maps and materials but the best thing was the huge contour map of Iceland. Very neat map to walk around and see the topography from a birds-eye view. My husband and I had a great time recounting our trip highlights as we walked around the "map." Also very nice pond out front to enjoy the ducks and sunshine!

title: Pretty, cozy and clean place to stop
text: Nice owner, yummy waffles, and good beer and coffee...a perfect spot to stop and pull over for a driving break. The place was cute and conveniently located.

title: This is a must-see waterfall
text: Yes, Iceland is full of amazing waterfalls and this one is far off the Ring Road, but make time to see it...it is jaw-dropping in scale and scope. Go at a time (morning or evening) to avoid crowds and you will have a much nicer experience. My husband and I went early in the morning and were rewarded with spectacular rainbows that were beyond belief!

title: A great place to relax after exploring the island
text: Of course the puffins and the cliffs and the number 1 and number 2 attractions on Grimsey Island, but this little restaurant is a nice place to sit and relax after a day outside. A nice selection of beer and food. Nice staff. We lucked out with a sunny, warm day and enjoyed the outdoor porch seating.

title: Great value and nice food
text: Pizza was yummy, service was perfect, coffee was just as it should be. Convenient location right on the main walking area. Would definitely go again.

title: Extensive open-air museum
text: The Maiahugen Open-Air museum is an extensive collection of the finest buildings through time. It was a fascinating look at the history of the place.

title: Great Italian collection on tour
text: Great museum which offers a collection of modern Norwegian art to traveling displays. The building itself it quite interesting. The current Italian collection is fantastic!

title: A winter wonderland
text: Lots to see and do here...fantastic skiing and access to Olympic sports. Was amazing to get such a view from the top of the high jump!

title: Open when others were closed!
text: Nice pizzeria, friendly wait staff! Very close to the Basilica. The price was reasonable and the restaurant clean. Served as a nice place for a local lunch.

title: Amazing Basilica
text: A must-see if you are tracing the steps of St. Francis in Assisi. This is an amazingly huge basilica and is an important place in Assisi history. Must see the chapel within the chapel and the rose garden.
place: Basilica di Santa Maria degli Angeli - Porziuncola

title: Historical and architectural importance
text: The Pantheon is important on so many levels. It is an amazing example of Roman buildings and the dome has gone on to influence many centuries of architects all over the world. The building is beautiful inside and houses the tombs of renaissance artist Raphael and 2 kings.

title: A must-see, regardless of the crowds
text: One cannot visit Rome without going to see the Colosseum. The lines are ridiculous but buy a ticket online ahead of time and it helps reduce the wait a little bit. It is an architectural marvel.

title: The Renaissance Masterpiece
text:
Buy your Vatican/Sistine Chapel tickets online and skip the lines entirely. The Vatican museums can be overwhelming due to the amount of art and artifacts that you see, but you must take your time in the Sistine Chapel...look up and marvel at Michelangelo's back-breaking masterpiece. Also consider that he was a sculptor, architect, and lastly painter. This is an awe-inspiring work.
p.s. be a good tourist and don't try to take pictures in the Sistine Chapel...it is forbidden and reflects poorly when one tries to sneak a picture.

title: A must-see for Renaissance lovers
text: Rooms of Raphael! It is a marvel. Buy your tickets online ahead of time and skip the lines that curve along the Vatican City walls.

title: Highly recommended hotel in a fantastic location
text:
The location of this hotel alone is enough to recommend it as a safe and convenient place to stay while visiting Rome. It is steps away from Piazza Popolo so easy to get to by car with all the amenities of being in the walking district. The room was clean, the staff all wonderful, and the breakfast was excellent and offered a great variety of foods. The room was small but fine as we chose not to upgrade.
The only very slight drawback was slow wifi, but that was not a big issue.

title: Fantastic Apartment in Assisi
text: My husband, daughter, and myself stayed in one of the upper apartments. It offered a beautiful view across the piazza. The apartment was spacious, clean, and had everything you might need. The hostess was warm and friendly. The location could not have been better for staying in Assisi! We loved every minute of it!

title: Beautiful and sacred
text: Such an extensive basilica with amazing art and history. A must-see! Can walk to it from across Assisi and the walk is pleasant through small streets.
place: Basilica Papale e Sacro Convento di San Francesco d'Assisi

title: Favorite church in Assisi
text: I thoroughly enjoyed walking through the olive groves to this sacred church. It is quiet, the views are beautiful and you get a sense of the history. It is a place of peace and reverence.

title: The location at sunset and sunrise is perfect!
text: You don't have to pay to go into the castle ruins to appreciate the views from this hilltop location! The castle was interesting to tour but we went back twice to the hilltop just to enjoy the views!

title: Beautiful dining area
text: Loved the intimacy of this beautiful old stone restaurant. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The pizza was excellent!

title: They don't regulate carry-on luggage
text: The staff was fine but our first flight was delayed because passengers were allowed to bring a ridiculous amount of hand-luggage onto the plane. The overhead bins filled early on, people were trying to find a place to stow their luggage and because of this the plane missed the departure slot and had to wait an hour until the next opening. Two connecting flights were missed in Brussels and people had to rebook flights just because of other people bringing too much hand-luggage. My husband and I each had one small carry-on and had to shove that under the seat in front of us as all overhead bins were full of other passengers bags. This should be regulated by the airline and carry-on limits enforced for the good of all the passengers.

title: Excellent food, nice service
text: Ate here several times and all meals were excellent. Wait staff is very helpful in making suggestions. Service is very timely.

title: Great atmosphere, fantastic food!!!
text: An incredible menu...something for everyone. The food is delicious, the atmosphere very quiet and relaxing...and again the meal choices endless. The service is friendly and timely.

title: My favorite Memorial in DC
text: A very tasteful and moving memorial with fountains, quotes, and beautiful arrangement. It is a peaceful walk through the area with quotes that help you to appreciate the philosophy of this remarkable American.

title: Welcoming, friendly, tasty
text: Dined here twice because the first dinner was so lovely. Great food, great service. Nice location right in the historic section of Bad Tolz.

title: Great location and very clean
text: The room was simple but clean and had all necessities. The location was superb to explore the gem that is Hellnar. Lovely beach access and hiking areas. Food was fine, a bit pricey. The only issue I had with the hotel was the reception staff being cold and abrupt. Rather giving off a condescending feel. All other staff were wonderful but I must admit that the desk staff rather tainted my feel of the hotel.

title: Very handy, clean, efficient!
text: I cannot say enough about the location of this hotel! Steps from the train station and convenient to the main attractions in Oslo. I only stayed one night but was so pleased with my choice. Great bathroom, simple room, all I needed. Would probably be a little small for a multi-day stay, but for my one night stay it was perfect. Staff friendly and helpful. Room spotless!
